intro: Tanacetum atkinsonii, commonly known as Atkinson's tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
